greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q^(-1/2)*eta(q)^2*eta(q^6)^3/(eta(q^2)*eta(q^3)^2) in powers of q.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
formula: a(n) = b(2n+1) where b(n) is multiplicative and b(2^e) = 0^e, b(3^e) = -2 if e>0, b(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 6), b(p^e) = (1+(-1)^e)/2 if p == 5 (mod 6).
mathematica: QP = QPochhammer; s = QP[q]^2*(QP[q^6]^3/(QP[q^2]*QP[q^3]^2)) + O[q]^105; CoefficientList[s, q] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 30 2015, adapted from PARI *)
program: (PARI) {a(n)=local(A, p, e); if(n<0, 0, n=2*n+1; A=factor(n); prod( k=1, matsize(A)[1], if(p=A[k, 1], e=A[k, 2]; if(p==2, 0, if(p==3, -2, if(p%6==1, e+1, !(e%2)))))))}
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Oct 02 2006
